intro: Minuartia saxifraga, commonly known as the rock jasmine, is a low-growing flowering plant native to rocky and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in crevices or on rock surfaces. Minuartia saxifraga is an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and soil stabilization.
